clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Stem Cell Therapy Combined With Psychological Therapy and Rehabilitation for Autism
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Stem Cell Therapy Combined With Psychological Therapy and Rehabilitation for Autism: An Open Label Controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

clinical_study.source: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cells combined with Psychological Therapy and Rehabilitation for Autism children

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cells combined with Psychological Therapy and Rehabilitation in the management of autism of 60 patients at Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology Hanoi, Vietnam from January 2017 to December 2018

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the change in autism level by using tools
primary_outcome.description: using total score of childhood autism rating scale, autism diagnostic observation schedule second edition, DENVER II, Indian Scale for assessment of Autism

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety of therapy by record number of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

arm_group.description: Stem cell transplantation 2 intrathecal administrations of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells at baseline and 6 months afterward

intervention.description: Transplantation of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear cells
Psychological Therapy and Rehabilitation for autism children around 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of autism according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-V diagnostic criteria for autistic disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Epilepsy
- Hydrocephalus with ventricular drain
- Coagulation disorders
- Allergy to anesthetic agents
- Severe health conditions such as cancer, failure of heart, lung, liver or kidney
- Active infections
- Severe psychiatric disorders
- Rett syndrome
- Fragile X syndrome
